geograph.org.uk - 1758354.jpg |static_image_caption = Old Street Roundabout |charingX_distance_mi = 2.5 |charingX_direction = WSW }} '''East London Tech City''' (also known as '''Tech City''' and '''Silicon Roundabout''') is the term for a [[Science park|technology cluster]] of high-tech companies located in [[Shoreditch]]/[[St Luke's, London|St Luke's]] and also in [[Hackney Wick]] in [[London]], England.<ref name=bbcreveal>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-11689437|title=Cameron reveals Silicon Valley vision for east London|accessdate=4 November 2010|publisher=BBC News|date=4 November 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/article/BT-CO-20101103-723812.html |title=UK's Cameron To Reveal Plans For Tech City In East London |accessdate=4 November 2010 |publisher=The Wall Street Journal |date=4 November 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101107034514/http://online.wsj.com/article/BT-CO-20101103-723812.html |archivedate=7 November 2010 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/silicon-valley-ndash-but-in-the-east-end-promises-pm-2124592.html|title=Silicon Valley – but in the East End, promises PM|accessdate=4 November 2010|publisher=The Independent|date=4 November 2010|location=London|first=Andrew|last=Grice}}</ref> Its nucleus broadly occupies an area between [[St Luke's, London|St Luke's]] and [[Hackney Road]].<ref name=bbcreveal/>
A cluster of web businesses initially developed around the [[Old Street Roundabout]] in 2008. The area had historically been relatively run down compared to the City. The [[Great Recession|2008–09 recession]] further suppressed rents through the closure of numerous firms, making it affordable to technology start-ups, while redundancies from financial services companies, such as [[investment bank]]s, released a pool of experienced talent interested in entrepreneurship.<ref name=Telegraph20180318>{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/the-silicon-joke/|title=The Silicon joke? From roundabout to revolution|date=2018-03-18|work=The Telegraph|access-date=2018-03-19|language=en-GB|issn=0307-1235}}</ref>
From 2010, as the cluster developed, both local and national government supported its growth, with the goal of creating a cluster comparable to [[Silicon Valley]] in the [[United States]].<ref name=bbcreveal/><ref name=tech>{{cite news|url=http://www.techrepublic.com/article/first-came-the-artists-then-came-the-hackers-the-strange-history-of-londons-own-silicon-valley|title=First came the artists, then came the hackers: The strange history of London’s own Silicon Valley|accessdate=16 January 2014|publisher=Tech Republic|date=16 January 2014}}</ref> [[Cisco Systems|Cisco]], [[Facebook]], [[Google]], [[Intel Corporation|Intel]], [[McKinsey & Company]] and [[Microsoft]] are among the companies that have invested in the area.<ref name=no10announce>{{cite web|url=http://www.number10.gov.uk/news/topstorynews/2010/11/pm-announces-east-london-tech-city-56606|title=PM announces East London ‘tech city’|publisher=Number 10|accessdate=4 November 2010}}</ref> [[City, University of London]], [[London Metropolitan University]], [[Imperial College London]], [[Queen Mary University of London]] and [[University College London]] are all academic partners in projects based in the cluster.<ref name=speech>{{cite web|url=http://www.number10.gov.uk/news/speeches-and-transcripts/2010/11/east-end-tech-city-speech-56602|title=East End tech city speech|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20130109092234/http://number10.gov.uk/news/east-end-tech-city-speech/|publisher=Number 10|accessdate=4 November 2010 | archivedate = 9 January 2013}}</ref><ref name=MDE>{{cite web|title=Mapping the Digital Economy: Tech City and the University|url=http://www.londonmet.ac.uk/fms/MRSite/Research/cities/Publications%202011/Mapping_the_Digital_Economy%5b1%5d.pdf|publisher=Cities Institute, London Metropolitan Business School|accessdate=24 November 2012}}</ref>
==History== Technology companies located in the area in 2008 included [[Dopplr]], [[Last.fm]], Consolidated Independent, Trampoline Systems, [[Avoiding Mass Extinctions Engine|AMEE]], Skimbit (now [[Skimlinks]]), [[Songkick]], Poke London, Kizoom, Redmonk, [[moo.com|MOO]], LShift, Ket Lai, Solstice and Schulze & Webb.<ref name=Telegraph20180318/> Other early companies to locate there were Tinker.it, [[flubit]], [[TweetDeck]], Berg, Fotango, weartical.com, Rummble, [[Squiz]], Techlightenment, BrightLemon, Believe.in, [[Livemusic]] and WAYN.
Plans to help accelerate the growth of the cluster were announced by [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|Prime Minister]] [[David Cameron]] in a speech given in east London on 4 November 2010.<ref name=no10announce/> A year later, Cameron announced that he was appointing entrepreneur [[Eric van der Kleij]] to lead the initiative.<ref name="indy">{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/profiles/eric-van-der-kleij-no-10-guru-set-to-super-charge-uks-tech-city-2350920.html|title=Eric van der Kleij: No 10 guru set to super charge UK's Tech City|last=Clark|first=Nick|date=8 September 2011|work=[[The Independent]]|accessdate=18 November 2011|location=London}}</ref> In 2010 there were 85 startup companies in the area.<ref name=WiredSR>{{cite news |url=https://www.wired.co.uk/magazine/archive/2010/02/start/silicon-roundabout |publisher=Wired Magazine |title=London's Silicon Roundabout |date=29 January 2010}}</ref> By 2011, approximately 200 firms were occupying the area, signifying a rapid increase in interest.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.searchofficespace.com/sos-news/tech-city-london%E2%80%99s-silicon-valley.html|title=Tech-City, London’s Silicon Valley|publisher=|accessdate=6 November 2016}}</ref> ''[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]'' magazine updated this figure in 2012 and suggested some 5,000 tech companies were located in the wider area centred on the Old Street roundabout.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2012-02/06/silicon-roundabout|title=London's Silicon Roundabout|first=|last=WIRED|publisher=|accessdate=6 November 2016}}</ref> Wired maintains a topic on the area.<ref>[https://www.wired.co.uk/topics/silicon-roundabout here]</ref>
On 28 September 2011 it was announced that Google had acquired a seven-storey building near Old Street roundabout. Google said that the building, in Bonhill Street, would host "a range of activities, such as speaker series, [[hackathon]]s, training workshops and product demonstrations" in addition to providing workspace for new companies.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-15088359 |publisher=BBC News |title=Google Boosts London's Silicon Roundabout \date=28 September 2011}}</ref> The building, known as Campus London, opened in March 2012.
In 2013 the Nominet Trust selected "5 startups making positive social change" which are based in the cluster: [[Streetbank]], [[Give What You’re Good At]], [[Videre Est Credere]], [[Buddy App]] and [[PaveGen]].<ref>Tech City News, "[http://techcitynews.com/2013/08/15/londons-top-tech-for-social-good/ London's Top Tech for Social Good]," 13 August 2013.</ref>
A report by [[Ernst & Young|EY]] published in 2016 highlighted the importance of London to the UK's [[FinTech]] industry in terms of availability of expertise and demand for services.<ref>{{cite web|title=An evaluation of the international FinTech sector|url=https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/502995/UK_FinTech_-_On_the_cutting_edge_-_Full_Report.pdf|publisher=EY|accessdate=25 February 2016|date=24 February 2016}}</ref>
===Investment=== Investment in London's technology sector was $2.28 billion in 2015, 69 per cent higher than the $1.3 billion raised in 2014. Since 2010, London-based technology companies have collectively raised $5.2 billion of venture capital funding.<ref>{{cite web|title=UK tech firms smash venture capital funding record|url=http://www.londonandpartners.com/media-centre/press-releases/2016/20160106-vc-barometer-q4|publisher=London & Partners|accessdate=2 February 2016|date=6 January 2016}}</ref>

===Educational institutions=== Educational institutions active in the cluster include: * [[Imperial Innovations]] (the technology-transfer company of [[Imperial College London]]) – has agreed to advise on the creation of an accelerator space for spinout companies at the Olympic Park<ref name=speech/> * [[Loughborough University]] and [[University College London]] – have agreed to work with the Olympic Legacy Company to establish a bridge between academia and enterprise in the Olympic Park<ref name=speech/> * [[London Metropolitan University]] – has their own student accelerator and business incubator "Accelerator London" in 35 Kingsland Road
===Financial and professional services providers=== Financial and professional services providers active in the cluster include: * [[Barclays]] – has agreed to create a new facility to provide specialist banking services to technology companies based in the area<ref name=speech/> * [[KPMG]] – opened a dedicated office in January 2013 providing accounting and tax advice to early-stage technology companies<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.accountancyage.com/aa/news/2230414/kpmg-sets-up-tech-city-garrison|title=KPMG sets up Tech City garrison|publisher=Accountancy Age|date=7 December 2012}}</ref> * [[McKinsey & Company]] – has agreed to provide advice on the creation of the hub and help to new companies starting out in the area<ref name=speech/> * [[Silicon Valley Bank]] – has agreed to establish a UK-based bank to provide financing for technology and life science companies based in the area<ref name=speech/> * [[Capco]] – relocated their UK headquarters to Great Eastern Street in 2014 (along with BOLD ROCKET), and is currently providing office space for small FinTech startups<ref name=speech/> * [[Taylor Wessing]] – opened the cluster's first dedicated law firm office in October 2011<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cityam.com/news-and-analysis/tech-city-gets-law-firm-boost|title=Tech City gets law firm boost|accessdate=15 October 2013|publisher=City AM|date=24 October 2011}}</ref>
===Community organisations=== A number of not-for-profit organisations have created a sense of community in the area including Independent Shoreditch,<ref>[http://www.inshoreditch.co.uk Independent Shoreditch]</ref> a business alliance, and [[Digital Shoreditch]], which organises monthly meet-ups plus an annual festival of the same name.
East London Radio launched in 2013 as an on-line talk community radio station run entirely by volunteers, with studios in several East London boroughs.
===Public sector organisations=== Public sector organisations active in the cluster include: * [[City of London Corporation]] – assisted in the creation of the [[Innovation Warehouse]] * [[Tech City Investment Organisation]] (TCIO) – a quango founded by the UK Government department [[UK Trade & Investment]] to encourage the growth and development of the Tech City cluster.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ukti.gov.uk/investintheuk/sectoropportunities/ict/item/124866.html|title=Tech City UK: The Digital Capital of Europe|accessdate=6 April 2013|publisher=UK Trade & Investment}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2013/mar/13/tech-city-technology-strategy-board|title=Tech City startups voice criticisms over Technology Strategy Board|accessdate=6 April 2013|publisher=The Guardian| date=13 March 2013|location=London|first=Jay|last=McGregor}}</ref>
==Housing== As the cluster expands, a number of developments have been/or are due to be built, such as by ASAP Member Cuckooz, who launched its latest design-led apartments in 2018, targeted towards the tech companies and offer apartments in a renovated art deco style cinema dating back to 1870, and features a new arthouse cinema on the ground floor.<ref>https://hub.theasap.org.uk/cuckooz-launches-biggest-project-to-date-in-east-london-tech-city/</ref> While, the Atlas Building on Old Street has full planning permission and is substantially already pre-sold on the market.<ref>https://urbanexposureplc.com/project/the-atlas-building/</ref> and The Maker, which is situated on Nile Street close to City Road on the very edge of Tech City and designed by Avanti Architects, which is underdevelopment and will provide 175 contemporary, apartments within an elegant 28-storey tower and connected low-rise building.<ref>https://carocommunications.com/londonewcastle-launches-new-homes-shoreditch-makers/</ref>
==Responses== The rapid growth of the cluster has met with some criticism. [[Think tank]] 'Centre for London' said the development had little focus and could be counter-productive. The think tank also raised concerns over a skills shortage, connectivity, lack of mentoring and rising costs.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Government's Tech City start-up strategy criticised |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-18650145 |work=BBC News |date=29 June 2012 |accessdate=12 October 2012}}</ref> Tech City has been called a "marketing gimmick" on the wrong side of London (away from [[Heathrow Airport]]) which is still over 30% more expensive than any city outside London.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Manchester is magnet for tech pioneers |url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/0e5f574a-0e6d-11e2-b87e-00144feabdc0.html#axzz292WSHFla |work=The FT |date=10 October 2012 |accessdate=12 October 2012}}</ref> <ref>{{Cite news |title=Choosing a UK business bank account |url=http://veg-buildlog.blogspot.co.uk/search?q=business+bank+account |work=Blog post |date=19 July 2015 |accessdate=10 July 2017}}</ref>[[James Dyson]] criticised the government for spending money on the scheme to attract international companies who drive up rents instead of helping start-up and hardware companies who he argues have greater potential than software and internet companies.<ref>{{Cite news |title=James Dyson criticises government focus on software and Tech City |url=http://www.computerworlduk.com/#ixzz292ZK9JCk |work=pcadvisor.co.uk |date=26 September 2012 |accessdate=12 October 2012}}</ref>
==Transport== [[London Underground]] [[Northern line]] (City branch) and [[National Rail]] [[Northern City Line]] which is operated by [[Thameslink and Great Northern|Great Northern]] provide services at [[Old Street station|Old Street]]. With the increase in passenger numbers using the station, in 2014 [[Transport for London]] announced that it was to offer [[pop-up retail]] space at Old Street station as part of a drive to increase its revenue.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://tfl.gov.uk/info-for/media/press-releases/2014/april/pop-up-shops-arrive-at-old-street-tube-station-to-reflect-the-vibrancy-of-tech-city|title=Pop-up shops arrive at Old Street Tube station|first=Transport for London |last=Matters|publisher=|accessdate=6 November 2016}}</ref>

{{Stack| [[Image:Isoquant map.png|thumb|250px|An isoquant map where production output Q3 > Q2 > Q1. Typically inputs X and Y would refer to labor and capital respectively. More of input X, input Y, or both is required to move from isoquant Q1 to Q2, or from Q2 to Q3.]] [[Image:Isoquant perfectsubs.png|thumb|250px|A) Example of an isoquant map with two inputs that are perfect substitutes.]] [[Image:Isoquant perfect compliments.png|thumb|250px|B) Example of an isoquant map with two inputs that are perfect complements.]] }}
An '''isoquant''' (derived from quantity and the Greek word iso, meaning equal) is a [[contour line]] drawn through the set of points at which the same quantity of output is produced while changing the quantities of two or more inputs.<ref>{{cite book |last=Varian |first=Hal R. |title=Microeconomic Analysis |edition=Third |publisher=Norton |year=1992 |isbn=0-393-95735-7 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=m20iQAAACAAJ }}</ref><ref>{{cite book |last=Chiang |first=Alpha C. |title=Fundamental Methods of Mathematical Economics |edition=Third |publisher=McGraw-Hill |year=1984 |isbn=0-07-010813-7 |pages=359–363 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=6gcoAQAAMAAJ&pg=PA359 }}</ref> While an [[indifference curve]] mapping helps to solve the utility-maximizing problem of consumers, the isoquant mapping deals with the cost-minimization problem of producers. Isoquants are typically drawn along with [[isocost ]]curves in [[Conditional factor demands|capital-labor graph]]s, showing the technological tradeoff between capital and labor in the [[production function]], and the decreasing marginal returns of both inputs. Adding one input while holding the other constant eventually leads to decreasing marginal output, and this is reflected in the shape of the isoquant. A family of isoquants can be represented by an '''isoquant map''', a graph combining a number of isoquants, each representing a different quantity of output. Isoquants are also called equal product curves.
[[File:TE-Production-Isoquant.png|thumb|250px|left|Production isoquant (strictly convex) and [[isocost]] curve (linear)]]
An isoquant shows that extent to which the firm in question has the ability to substitute between the two different inputs at will in order to produce the same level of output. An isoquant map can also indicate decreasing or increasing [[returns to scale]] based on increasing or decreasing distances between the isoquant pairs of fixed output increment, as output increases. If the distance between those isoquants increases as output increases, the firm's production function is exhibiting decreasing returns to scale; doubling both inputs will result in placement on an isoquant with less than double the output of the previous isoquant. Conversely, if the distance is decreasing as output increases, the firm is experiencing increasing returns to scale; doubling both inputs results in placement on an isoquant with more than twice the output of the original isoquant.
As with indifference curves, two isoquants can never cross. Also, every possible combination of inputs is on an isoquant. Finally, any combination of inputs above or to the right of an isoquant results in more output than any point on the isoquant. Although the marginal product of an input decreases as you increase the quantity of the input while holding all other inputs constant, the marginal product is never negative in the empirically observed range since a [[Rational choice theory|rational]] firm would never increase an input to decrease output.
An isoquants shows all those combinations of factors which produce same level of output. An isoquants is also known as equal product curve or iso-product curve. It describes the firm's alternative methods for producing a given level of output.
==Shapes of Isoquants== If the two inputs are perfect substitutes, the resulting isoquant map generated is represented in fig. A; with a given level of production Q3, input X can be replaced by input Y at an unchanging rate. The perfect substitute inputs do not experience decreasing marginal rates of return when they are substituted for each other in the production function.
If the two inputs are perfect complements, the isoquant map takes the form of fig. B; with a level of production Q3, input X and input Y can only be combined efficiently in the certain ratio occurring at the kink in the isoquant. The firm will combine the two inputs in the required ratio to maximize profit.
Isoquants are typically combined with [[isocost]] lines in order to solve a cost-minimization problem for given level of output. In the typical case shown in the top figure, with smoothly curved isoquants, a firm with fixed unit costs of the inputs will have isocost curves that are linear and downward sloped; any point of tangency between an isoquant and an isocost curve represents the cost-minimizing input combination for producing the output level associated with that isoquant. A line joining tangency points of isoquants and isocosts (with input prices held constant) is called the [[expansion path]].<ref name="Salvatore">Salvatore, Dominick (1989). ''Schaum's outline of theory and problems of managerial economics,'' McGraw-Hill, {{ISBN|978-0-07-054513-7}}</ref>
The only relevant portion of the isoquant is the one that is convex to the origin, part of the curve which is not convex to the origin implies negative marginal product for factors of production. The higher the isoquant, the higher the production.

'''John Dowd''' (born December 11, 1966) is an American-born executive. He is the CEO and co-founder of Sundance Vacations, a wholesale vacation company based in [[Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania]],<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url = https://www.bloomberg.com/Research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=59597351&privcapId=31068608&previousCapId=31068608&previousTitle=Sundance%20Vacations%20Inc.|title = Executive Profile: John Dowd|date = |accessdate = October 6, 2015|website = Bloomberg Business|publisher = Bloomberg.com|last = |first = }}</ref> and is also a very active member of the community, serving on the Greater Wilkes-Barre Chamber of Commerce,<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.wilkes-barre.org/greater-wilkes-barre-chamber-of-commerce-board.html|title = Greater Wilkes-Barre Chamber of Commerce Board|date = |accessdate = October 6, 2015|website = Greater Wilkes-Barre Chamber of Commerce|publisher = Greater Wilkes-Barre Chamber of Commerce|last = |first = }}</ref> as the chair of the grants committee for the Luzerne Foundation and the Parent Advisor for the Youth Advisory Committee.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url = http://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/CREC-2011-04-15/html/CREC-2011-04-15-pt1-PgE743-3.htm|title = Congressional Record|date = April 15, 2011|accessdate = 10 September 2015|website = Government Publishing Office|publisher = United States Publishing Office|last = |first = }}</ref> He also serves on the board of trustees for [[Wyoming Seminary]].<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.wyomingseminary.org/cf_news/view.cfm?newsid=326|title = Wyoming Seminary welcomes new Board of Trustees members|last = |first = |date = September 3, 2012|work = Wyoming Seminary News Release|access-date = September 10, 2015|via = }}</ref>
Dowd, with the help of his wife Tina, co-founded Sundance Vacations in 1991 after working in the [[vacation]] industry.
Dowd purchased a new property and built the current headquarters of his business in 2007.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://hinerfeldcommercial.com/2007/11/14/detter-helps-sundance-vacations-find-new-home/ | title=Detter Helps Sundance Vacations Find New Home | publisher=Hinerfeld Commercial Real Estate | date=November 14, 2007 | accessdate=October 6, 2015 | last=Detter | first=Shannon | website=hinerfeldcommercial.com}}</ref>
==Early life, education and career== Dowd was born in [[Sunbury, Pennsylvania]]<ref name=":1" /> and attended [[Shikellamy High School]].<ref name=":0" /> Later, he received a [[Bachelor of Engineering]] from [[Penn State University]].<ref name=":1" /> Dowd also served as an Army Reservist with the [[United States Army Reserve]].
His career with Sundance Vacations started in 1991 as a small marketing operation with just himself and his wife. The company has since grown to employ over 700 employees<ref name=":0" /> and has offices in four states. Dowd began the [[permission marketing]] portion of Sundance Vacations in 2003.
==Charitable endeavors== In 2013, Dowd, along with his wife Tina, donated $50,000 to St. Vincent de Paul Soup Kitchen located in [[Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania]].<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://citizensvoice.com/news/sundance-vacations-owners-donate-50-000-to-food-kitchen-1.1223850|title = Sundance Vacations owners donate $50,000 to food kitchen|last = Wellock|first = Bill|date = October 27, 2011|work = Citizens' Voice|access-date = September 10, 2015|via = }}</ref> The company donated $5,000 to the Wyoming Valley Children's Association (WVCA) and was the presenting sponsor for the April 22, 2017 [http://www.wvcakids.org/support-our-students/walk-a-thon/ Walk-a-Thon]. Sundance Vacations is also a supporter of [[Volunteers in Medicine]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volunteers_in_Medicine|title=Volunteers in Medicine|last=Miller|first=Mark|date=June 22, 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>{{Better source|reason=per WP:CIRCULAR|date=April 2018}} This year, they were the Hulu sponsor at the $5,000 level for the annual fundraiser that they have participated in for over three years. John Dowd is partnering with the [[United Way of America|United Way]] of NEPA and [[NASCAR]] for the Race for the Kids covered by [http://wnep.com/2017/07/28/racing-to-feed-the-hungry/ WNEP]. This event held at the [[Pocono Raceway]], also known as the "tricky triangle" will raise awareness of, and generate revenue for early childhood education in the community. [[Derrike Cope|Derrick Cope]], #55 is the sponsored driver for the event .
==Awards== Dowd was named to the [[Glassdoor]] list of the Highest Rated CEOs for Small and Medium Businesses in North America on June 10, 2015.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://fortune.com/2015/06/10/top-small-business-ceos/|title = These are the top-rated small business CEOs|last = Roberts|first = Daniel|date = June 10, 2015|work = Fortune Magazine|access-date = September 10, 2015|via = }}</ref>
Dowd was honored by the Association of Fundraising Professionals, in 2014, as an Outstanding [[Philanthropist]].<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://thetimes-tribune.com/news/business/business-briefcase-november-16-2014-1.1788584|title = Business Briefcase, November 16, 2014|last = Baress|first = Joe|date = November 16, 2014|work = The Times-Tribune|access-date = September 10, 2015|via = }}</ref>
Dowd, and his wife Tina, were recognized by [[U.S. Representative]] of [[Pennsylvania's 11th congressional district]], [[Lou Barletta]], and were awarded the [[Volunteers of America]] Spirit of Youth Award.<ref name=":0" />

[[King Khalid]] |term_start = 1965 |term_end = 1979 |predecessor = |successor = [[Turki Al Faisal]] |birth_date = 1929 |birth_place = [[Istanbul]], [[Turkey]] |death_date = 29 October {{death year and age|1999|1929}} |death_place = [[Cairo]], [[Egypt]] |spouse = |children = |party = |otherparty = |alma_mater = [[Victoria College, Alexandria|Victoria College]]
[[Cambridge University]] |religion = |footnotes = }} '''Kamal Adham''' (1929 – 29 October 1999) ({{lang-ar|كمال أدهم}}) was a businessman and former director general of [[Saudi Arabia]]'s [[Al Mukhabarat Al A'amah]] or the general intelligence directorate. He served as a royal counsellor to both [[King Faisal bin Abdul Aziz|King Faisal]] and [[King Khalid]]. ==Early life and education== Kamal Adham was born in [[Istanbul]] 1929. His father, Ibrahim Adham, was a police officer, who was of [[Albanian people|Albanian]] origin.{{cite news|author=Joseph A. Kechichian|title=Self-assurance in the face of military might|url=http://gulfnews.com/life-style/people/self-assurance-in-the-face-of-military-might-1.967216|accessdate=21 July 2013|newspaper=Gulf News|date=20 January 2012}} His mother, Asia, was [[Turkish people|Turkish]].{{cite news|author=Linda Blandford|title=In Jeddah, the future arrived yesterday|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2206&dat=19770421&id=zzo0AAAAIBAJ&sjid=iOsFAAAAIBAJ&pg=1050,332207|accessdate=26 February 2013|newspaper=The Miami News|date=21 April 1977}} Adham had two half-siblings, including [[Iffat Al-Thunayan|Iffat Al Thunayan]], and a full-brother, Muzaffar. Adham went to [[Jeddah]] with his father when he was one year old. He was raised by [[Faisal of Saudi Arabia|King Faisal]], spouse of his sister Iffat.{{cite news|title=BAE Files: Kamal Adham|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2007/jun/08/bae49|accessdate=12 May 2012|newspaper=The Guardian|date=8 June 2007|author=David Leigh|author2=Rob Evans}} Adham studied at [[Victoria College, Alexandria|Victoria College]] in [[Alexandria]]{{cite news|title=About the Bin Laden family|url=https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/pages/frontline/shows/binladen/who/family.html|accessdate=26 February 2013|work=PBS}} and then at [[Cambridge University]]. He was fluent in [[Arabic language|Arabic]], [[Turkish language|Turkish]], [[English language|English]] and [[French language|French]].{{cite news|author=Joseph A. Kechichian|title=The man behind the scenes|url=http://gulfnews.com/news/gulf/uae/general/the-man-behind-the-scenes-1.581564|accessdate=26 February 2013|newspaper=Gulf News|date=12 February 2010}} ==Career== King Faisal appointed Kamal Adham as head of [[Al Mukhabarat Al A'amah]] (later renamed General Intelligence Presidency, GIP) in 1965, making him the first president of the GIP.{{cite news|author=Dean Baquet|title=After Plea Bargain by Sheik, Question Is What He Knows|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1992/07/30/business/the-bcci-scandal-after-plea-bargain-by-sheik-question-is-what-he-knows.html?pagewanted=all&src=pm|accessdate=26 February 2013|newspaper=The New York Times|date=30 July 1992}}{{cite news|title=Prince Nawaf new intelligence chief|url=http://www.arabnews.com/node/214954|accessdate=6 April 2013|newspaper=Arab News|date=1 September 2001}} Adham's tenure lasted for fourteen years until 1979 when he was replaced by [[Turki bin Faisal Al Saud|Turki bin Faisal]] in the post.{{cite news|title=Takeover figure guilty in case involving IBCCI|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=XoZQAAAAIBAJ&sjid=0xIEAAAAIBAJ&pg=4397,7298227&dq=heads+of+saudi+intelligence&hl=en|accessdate=26 February 2013|newspaper=The Milwaukee Sentinel|date=29 July 1992}} Therefore, he also served as the head of the GID during [[King Khalid]]'s term. Adham also served as royal counsellor to King Faisal and then, to King Khalid.{{cite news|author=Nick Luddington|title=King Faisal's eight sons|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=j58gAAAAIBAJ&sjid=m2gFAAAAIBAJ&pg=1190,870999&dq=kamal+adham&hl=en|accessdate=26 February 2013|newspaper=Lewiston Evening Journal|date=5 April 1975|agency=AP|location=Jeddah}}{{cite news|author=Nick Thimmesch|title=The Egyptian-Saudi peace axis|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=cEhVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=SD4NAAAAIBAJ&pg=1985,575808&dq=kamal+adham&hl=en|accessdate=26 February 2013|newspaper=The News Dispatch|date=7 April 1977|location=Washington}} Adham was among the close advisors to King Khalid throughout the latter's reign from 1975 to 1982. ===Activities as the GIP head=== Adham was very crucial in maintaining the relations with Egypt. CIA financially supported [[Anwar Sadat]], then vice president of [[Gamal Nasser]], through Adham when Sadat had financial problems. Adham was also sent by King Faisal to meet Sadat in May 1971, shortly after he was sworn in as president. Adham tried to persuade him to cooperate with the US.{{cite book|author=Joseph J. Trento|title=Prelude to Terror: The Rogue CIA And The Legacy Of America's Private Intelligence Network|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=rAAU3_cIKIQC&pg=PA238|accessdate=26 February 2013|date=21 March 2006|publisher=Basic Books|isbn=978-0-7867-3881-6|page=238}} In the meeting, Sadat stated that after the completion of the Israeli withdrawn from Egypt, he would expel the Soviet forces from Egypt. He also assured that Adham could transmit his message to the US administration. As a result of Adham's visit, Sadat expelled nearly 16,000 Soviet advisors from the country in 1972.{{cite news|title=Obituaries in the News|url=http://www.apnewsarchive.com/1999/Obituaries-in-the-News/id-aa055e97f75f4958aed977c68e2bfbf7|accessdate=26 February 2013|work=AP|date=30 October 1999|location=Riyadh}} Adham told his associates in 1972 that the Shah of Iran, [[Mohammad Reza Pahlavi]], would be removed.{{cite news|title=The United States and Iran: The Secret History Part One: Carter and the Shah|url=http://www.dcbureau.org/20090727647/national-security-news-service/the-united-states-and-iran-the-secret-history-part-one-carter-and-the-shah.html|accessdate=7 April 2013|work=DC Bureau|date=27 July 2009|author=Joseph Trento|author2=Susan Trento}} His prediction was not taken into consideration or shared by advisors of the then US president [[Nixon Administration|Nixon]]. Adham acted as a liaison between the GIP, which reported to the king, and the US administration.{{cite news|title=The ghost of a Saudi billionaire haunts U.S. war on terror|url=http://www.unitedjerusalem.org/index2.asp?id=108968&Date=6/14/2002|accessdate=7 April 2013|work=The United Jerusalem Foundation|date=13 June 2002}} Additionally he was the primary laison of the CIA for the Middle East as a whole from the mid-1960s to 1979 when he left the GIP. He fostered and maintained nascent ties with several Arab intelligence services, as many were slowly creating independent institutions to serve their respective governments. Adham closely worked with [[George H. W. Bush]], who was appointed [[CIA]] director in 1976.{{cite news|title=Bush: Middle East ties deserve to be part of 2004 political debate|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=PlNWAAAAIBAJ&sjid=uesDAAAAIBAJ&pg=3766,3968714&dq=kamal+adham&hl=en|accessdate=26 February 2013|newspaper=Eugene Register Guard|date=18 January 2004}}{{cite book|author1=Jonathan Beaty|author2=Samuel C. Gwynne|title=The Outlaw Bank: A Wild Ride Into the Secret Heart of Bcci|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=M_vkgRD3QwwC&pg=PA275|accessdate=26 February 2013|date=1 January 2004|publisher=Beard Books|isbn=978-1-58798-146-3|page=275}} Adham signed the charter of [[Safari Club|the Safari Club]], an [[anti-communist]] foreign policy initiative proposed and realized by French intelligence chief [[Alexandre de Marenches]], on behalf of Saudi Arabia in 1976.{{cite book|author=Rachel Bronson|title=Thicker than Oil:America's Uneasy Partnership with Saudi Arabia|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=w9u-DSqvzUQC&pg=PA132|accessdate=7 April 2013|date=1 May 2006|publisher=Oxford University Press|isbn=978-0-19-974117-5|page=132}} The other participating countries of the Club were Egypt, [[Iran]] and [[Morocco]].{{cite book|author=Peter Dale Scott|title=The Road to 9/11: Wealth, Empire, and the Future of America|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=op39ymd2um0C&pg=PA80|accessdate=7 April 2013|date=5 August 2007|publisher=University of California Press|isbn=978-0-520-92994-4|page=105}} The first meeting of the group was held in Saudi Arabia in 1976. Adham became a significant figure in the Club and worked for it for a long time. ===Business activities=== Adham also had business activities, for which he used his connections with [[House of Saud|the House of Saud]]. His business dealings began in 1957, long before his post as the head of the GIP. He founded the Kamal Adham Group in Saudi Arabia, which became one of the biggest companies in the country.{{cite news|author=Saud Al Tuwaim|title=Mishaal gets control of Adham Group|url=http://www.arabnews.com/node/213191|accessdate=26 February 2013|newspaper=Arab News|date=18 February 2001}}{{cite news|title=Kamal Adham Group|url=http://www.zawya.com/middle-east/company/profile/1001898/Adham_Group/|accessdate=26 February 2013|work=Zawya|date=27 August 2007}} Raymond Close, a former CIA station chief in Saudi Arabia, left CIA and began to work for Adham in 1977 when he was the head of the GIP.{{cite book|author=John Cooley|title=Unholy Wars: Afghanistan, America and International Terrorism|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=J5C0R6qxjpgC&pg=PA91|accessdate=26 February 2013|date=20 June 2002|publisher=Pluto Press|isbn=978-0-7453-1917-9|page=91}}{{cite news|title=Dangerous Times|url=http://www.nysun.com/editorials/dangerous-times/44274/|accessdate=26 February 2013|newspaper=The New York Sun|date=29 November 2006}} Adham was also one of the major shareholders of the [[Bank of Credit and Commerce International]] (BCCI). Alongside his Business partner, Mr [[Sayed Al Jawhary]].{{cite journal|author=Christopher Byron|title=The Senate look at BCCI|journal=New York Magazine|date=28 October 1991|pages=20–21|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=e-kCAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA20 |accessdate=26 February 2013}} In 1972, he met the founder of the BCCI, [[Agha Hasan Abedi]]. The same year Adham founded a contracting firm, Almabani, in Saudi Arabia.{{cite web|author=Christopher Sell|title=Almabani General Contractors|url=http://www.almabani.co/Press_releases/2010/MEED_Press_Release_March_2010.pdf|work=Almabani|accessdate=7 April 2013|format=Press release|date=17 March 2010}} He and Mr Sayed al Jawhary were involved in many works in Egypt. In addition, his works with Mr Jawhary led them into investing in Adham's businesses in Saudi Arabia and places such as Marbella and Palma de Mallorca. He was one of the early shareholders of the influential media company, [[Saudi Research and Marketing Group|Saudi Research and Marketing]].{{cite journal|author=Jon B. Alterman|title=New Media New Politics?|journal=The Washington Institute|year=1998|volume=48|url=http://www.washingtoninstitute.org/uploads/Documents/pubs/PolicyPaper48.pdf|accessdate=7 April 2013}} In addition, he had investments in [[Egypt]], owning 4% of Delta Bank. And 2% to Mr Al Jawhary{{cite book|author=Gil Feiler|title=Economic Relations Between Egypt and the Gulf Oil States, 1967-2000: Petro Wealth and Patterns of Influence|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=VILtesILJSQC&pg=PA77|accessdate=26 February 2013|year=2003|publisher=Sussex Academic Press|isbn=978-1-903900-40-6|page=77}} He also became a business associate of Anwar Sadat's spouse, [[Jihan Sadat]], and other members of the Sadat family. In 1978, Adham founded a construction company, Freyssinet, in Saudi Arabia.{{cite news|title=KSA's Big 25 list of construction companies|url=http://www.constructionweekonline.com/article-21617-the-top-25-construction-companies-in-saudi-arabia/15/#.UWFq2JNSjm4|accessdate=7 April 2013|work=Construction Weekly|date=31 March 2013}} Adham along with [[Adnan Khashoggi]] and [[Sayed Al Jawhary]] was one of the founders of the gold company, Barrick Gold Corporation that was established in 1983.{{cite book|author=Rachel Verdon|title=Murder by Madness 9/11: The Government & the Goon Squad|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=PQrvfgXnG-UC&pg=PA319|accessdate=31 May 2013|date=2 February 2012|publisher=Rachel Verdon|isbn=978-1-4699-7022-6|page=319–}} In 2001, his son Mishaal was named as the chairman of the Kamal Adham Group. ===Controversy=== In 1961, then Saudi oil minister [[Abdullah Tariki]] claimed on evidence that Adham, who was dealing with business at that time, got 2% of the profits from the Arabian Oil Company that had been cofounded by Saudi Arabia and [[Japan]].{{cite book|author=Marius Vassiliou|authorlink= Marius Vassiliou|title=The A to Z of the Petroleum Industry|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=BdNjTbcB__0C&pg=PA496|accessdate=6 March 2013|date=24 September 2009|publisher=Scarecrow Press|isbn=978-0-8108-7066-6|page=496}} Adham involved in the huge BCCI scandal at the beginning of the 1990s.{{cite journal|title=Adham The Untouchable|journal=New York Magazine|date=7 October 1991|pages=25–26|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=4ugCAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA26&lpg=PA26&dq=kamal+adham&source=bl&ots=KUtJ0HrJxf&sig=6f3DcdN1TCmpld_3Sx7H6LeYbsE&hl=en&sa=X&ei=kM0sUeC6Msv4sgbi_YCQDg&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=kamal%20adham&f=false|accessdate=26 February 2013}} The US prosecutors accused him of playing a key role in the secret and illegal takeover of First American bank by BCCI.{{cite journal|title=BCCI, the CIA and foreign intelligence|journal=Federation of American Scientists|year=1992|url=http://www.fas.org/irp/congress/1992_rpt/bcci/11intel.htm|accessdate=7 April 2013}} {{cite news|author=Dean Baquet|title=Saudis Pay $225 Million To Settle a B.C.C.I. Tong Lung (唐龍; Chinese stage name) | occupation = Actor, martial artist | years_active = 1977–1986 | module = {{Infobox Korean name|child=yes|color=transparent | hangul = 김태정 | hanja = 金泰靖 | rr = Gim Tae-jeong | mr = Kim T'aejŏng }} }} '''Kim Tai-chung''' (June 5, 1957 – August 27, 2011), also known as '''Kim Tai-jong''' or '''Tong Lung''' (唐龍; Chinese stage name), was a [[Korea]]n born [[taekwondo]] practitioner martial artist actor and businessman. Kim is perhaps best known as the ghost of [[Bruce Lee]] in 1986 film ''[[No Retreat, No Surrender]]''. ==History and early career== ===Acting=== In the 1970s, Kim made his first Hong Kong movie debut in 1977 film ''[[Snuff Bottle Connection]]'', along with [[Hwang Jang-lee|Hwang Jang Lee]] and [[Roy Horan]]. Kim played Bruce Lee’s character Billy Lo in 1978 film ''[[Game of Death#Game of Death .281978.29|Game of Death]]'', alongside [[Yuen Biao]] (who performed the acrobatics and stunts), Kim played Lee's character so well that the producers used him again a few years later. In the 1980s, Kim played Bobby Lo in 1981 film ''[[Game of Death II]]'' alongside Hwang Jang Lee, Roy Horan, To Wai-wo and Lee Hoi-san. After ''Game of Death II'', Kim returned to Korea and playing Master Bruce in 1982 film ''Jackie vs. Bruce to the Rescue'' (also known as ''Fist of Death'') along with Lee Siu-ming (A Taiwanese Stuntman and [[Jackie Chan]] look alike.), and another Korean film ''[[Miss, Please Be Patient]]'', it was released in September 1981. In June 1985, Chinese film producer [[Ng See-yuen]] was looking for an actor to play the ghost of Bruce Lee in 1986 film ''[[No Retreat, No Surrender]]'' in his American debut and final film, which marked the film debut of Belgian martial artist actor [[Jean-Claude Van Damme]] as Ivan Kraschinsky. Kim played Bruce Lee to training [[Kurt McKinney]]'s martial artist. ===Retired from acting=== After ''No Retreat, No Surrender'', Kim returned to Korea and retired from acting at the age of 29 and became a businessman. In 2008, Kim made a rare public appearance in Korea as part of a screening of ''[[Miss, Please Be Patient]]'' (아가씨 참으세요),[http://history.pifan.com/film/film_detail.asp?f_num=12&cat1=173&cat2=&uid=2413 The Puchon International Fantastic Film Festival History: Miss, Please be Patient] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110721080926/http://history.pifan.com/film/film_detail.asp?f_num=12&cat1=173&cat2=&uid=2413 |date=2011-07-21 }} Retrieved on 22 July 2009. which had originally been released in 1981. Kim had played a leading role in that film. ==Death== On August 27, 2011, Kim died of stomach hemorrhage at the age of 54.{{cite web|url=http://www.hkcinemagic.com/en/people.asp?id=4168|title=Hong Kong Cinemagic - Kim Tai Jung}}{{cite web|url=http://www.cityonfire.com/kim-tai-chung-1943-2011-dead-died-death-jung/|title=R.I.P. Kim Tai Chung | work = cityonfire.com}} ==Filmography== ===Movies=== * ''[[Snuff Bottle Connection]]'' (1977) * ''[[Game of Death#Game of Death .281978.29|Game of Death]]'' (1978) * ''[[Game of Death II]]'' (1981) * ''[[Miss, Please Be Patient]]'' (1981) * ''[[Jackie and Bruce to the Rescue]]'' (1982) * ''[[No Retreat, No Surrender]]'' (1986) ===Documentary=== * ''[[Bruce Lee, the Man and the Legend]]'' (1984) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{IMDb name|1015087|Tai Chung Kim}} {{Bruce Lee}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kim, Tai-chung}} [[Category:South Korean male film actors]] [[Category:South Korean businesspeople]] [[Category:South Korean male taekwondo practitioners]] [[Category:1957 births]] [[Category:2011 deaths]] [[Category:Bruce Lee imitators]] {{SouthKorea-martialart-bio-stub}} {{Taekwondo-bio-stub}}

'''Liam Bates''' ({{zh|c=李牧|p=lǐmù}}) is an entrepreneur, television host and adventurer from [[Switzerland]], born June 28, 1988. Bates' first appearance on Chinese television was during the 2010 [[Chinese Bridge]] language contest, in which he received first prize and the eloquence prize. The show aired in front of a TV audience of almost 300 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://genevalunch.com/2010/08/09/vaud-youth-wins-eloquence-award-at-chinese-%E2%80%9Camerican-idol%E2%80%9D/ |title=GenevaLunch news » Vaud youth wins eloquence award at Chinese "American Idol" |publisher=Genevalunch.com |date= |accessdate=2013-03-02}}</ref> Bates has gone on to present TV shows for the [[Discovery Channel]] and has founded several companies in China. In 2017, Bates made the Forbes 30 under 30 list.<ref name="forbes.com">{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/30-under-30-asia/2017/consumer-technology/#7843c3792ef8|title=30 Under 30 Asia 2017: Consumer Technology|website=Forbes}}</ref>
==Early life== Liam Bates was born in the canton of Vaud outside Geneva, Switzerland to an American mother and a British-Zimbabwean father. At school he spoke French. He later went on to study Chinese and film at the [[University of British Columbia]] in Canada.<ref name="auto">{{cite web|url=http://french.xinhuanet.com/2014-06/30/c_133449028.htm |title=Un aventurier Suisse en Chine |publisher=XinHua |date= |accessdate=2016-10-17}}</ref>
==Television career==
Following Bates' [[Chinese Bridge]] success in September 2010 he joined The Travel Channel China as their newest host, where he began a regular travel series filmed throughout the Chinese countryside.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://europe.chinadaily.com.cn/epaper/2011-06/10/content_12670862.htm |title=Way of a warrior |publisher=Europe.chinadaily.com.cn |date=2011-06-10 |accessdate=2013-03-02}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/cndy/2011-03/22/content_12206179.htm |title=Road warrior gives thumbs-up to freewheeling hitchhiking |publisher=Chinadaily.com.cn |date=2011-03-22 |accessdate=2013-03-02}}</ref> His first shows focused on rural life in [[Hunan]], [[Guizhou]] and other Chinese provinces. Each show had Bates spending a week living with farmers and learning about their local cultures.
In 2011 Bates and 'The Travel Channel China' team spent two weeks in his home country of [[Switzerland]], filming several aspects of Swiss life: chocolate-making, Alpine cowherding and cheese production, [[Swiss military]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.swisscham.org/bei/pdf/chinese_discover_switzerland_eng.pdf | title=Chinese discover Switzerland through eyes of Swiss youth | date=27 July 2011 | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120710202722/http://www.swisscham.org/bei/pdf/chinese_discover_switzerland_eng.pdf | archivedate=2012-07-10 | type=Press release}}</ref> The resulting television show broke numerous records in China, with the first 30-minute episode registering 1.5 million views on video-sharing website [[Youku]] alone.<ref>{{cite web|author=/00:00 |url=http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XMzAxNjIzNDI0.html |title=跟着老外回家乡第一集 我爱我家 110905—在线播放—《有多远走多远 2011》—综艺—优酷网，视频高清在线观看 |publisher=V.youku.com |date= |accessdate=2013-03-02}}</ref> Bates became more widely known in China than in his home country.
In early 2012 Bates began a new series, ''A Love for Adventure'' (我爱大冒险) and the ''Last Tribe'' (最后的部落). In this show, he travelled around the world seeking out small tribes who have maintained their traditional lifestyles in order to learn their survival techniques.<ref>{{cite web|author=/00:00 |url=http://tv.cntv.cn/video/C11297/52fb4874af503ddd2e87d78c0a4e5c44 |title=《有多远走多远》 20130717 最后的部落 |publisher=tv.cntv.cn |date= |accessdate=2016-10-17}}</ref> In 2016 Bates completed filming of a new series for the [[Discovery Channel]], "Expedition X: Silk Road Rising".<ref>{{cite web|author=/00:00 |url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/denise-keller-adventurer-liam-bates-073500739.html |title=Denise Keller and Adventurer Liam Bates Discover What Defines China's Ancient Silk Road Today, on EXPEDITION X: SILK ROAD RISING |publisher=Yahoo Finance |date= |accessdate=2016-10-30}}</ref>
==Entrepreneur==
Bates started his first company in 2006 at 17 years old, Beijing-based Bridges to China.<ref name="auto"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bridgestochina.com/index.php?page=about |title=Learn martial arts and kung fu in China |publisher=Bridges to China |date= |accessdate=2016-10-17}}</ref> In 2014 Bates co-founded Kaiterra (formerly Origins Technology<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thebeijinger.com/blog/2017/04/14/origins-ofo-and-other-beijing-startup-stars-make-forbes-30-under-30-asia-list|title=Laser Egg's Creators Make Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia List; Rebrand as Kaiterra|first=Kyle|last=Mullin|date=14 April 2017|website=www.thebeijinger.com}}</ref>), a startup that develops IoT hardware and software products to measure global air quality and pollution levels.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://technode.com/2016/04/07/manufacturing-hardware-in-china-from-scratch-as-an-expat-qa-with-liam-bates-co-founder-of-origins-technology/ |title=Manufacturing hardware in China from scratch as an Expat - QA with Liam Bates, co-founder of Origins Technology |publisher=Tech in Asia |date= |accessdate=2016-10-17}}</ref> Kaiterra has raised an undisclosed amount from angel investors in an initial round of funding in January 2015.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/origins-2|title=Origins Technology {{!}} crunchbase|website=www.crunchbase.com|access-date=2016-10-17}}</ref> In April 2016, Kaiterra's consumer air quality monitor, the Laser Egg, entered the Apple Stores across China.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/new-gadgets-help-pollution-weary-chinese-breathe-easier-1460919605 |title=New Gadgets Help Pollution Weary Chinese Breathe Easier |publisher=The Wall Street Journal |date= |accessdate=2016-10-17}}</ref> In 2017, Bates and Kaiterra co-founder Jessica Lam were selected for the Forbes 30 under 30 list.<ref name="forbes.com"/>
==Hangzhou Ambassador==
In May 2013 Bates was officially appointed tourism ambassador to the Chinese city of [[Hangzhou]]. Bates was awarded a €40,000/year contract to regularly visit and explore [[Hangzhou]], sharing his experiences on social media under the title of the 'Modern Marco Polo'. This made him the first foreigner ever to be appointed by China's government in such an official role.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/travel/article-2634905/Briton-promote-China-Facebook-locals-banned-site.html |title=The Daily Mail » Briton appointed by Chinese government to promote the country on Facebook (but locals are still banned from the site) |publisher=The Daily Mail |date= |accessdate=2014-11-26}}</ref>
==Xiangsheng==
Bates was formally invited to begin the study of ''[[xiangsheng]]'' (a traditional form of "crosstalk" comedy) by famous Chinese comedian [[Ding Guangquan]] after his success in the [[Chinese Bridge]] contest.<ref>{{cite web|author=Justine |url=http://french.china.org.cn/culture/txt/2012-04/25/content_25229471.htm |title=La modernisation du xiangsheng pourrait favoriser sa renaissance |publisher=French.china.org.cn |date=2012-04-25 |accessdate=2013-03-02}}</ref> In February 2012, in a traditional ceremony at the [[Confucius Institute]], [[University of Hawaii]], he was formally accepted into the xiangsheng hierarchy when he took [[Ding Guangquan]] to be his [[Sifu|Shifu]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://confuciusinstitutehawaii.org/upcoming-events/past-events/xiangsheng-comic-dialogue-festival-with-master-ding-guangquan/ |title=» Xiangsheng (comic dialogue) festival with Master Ding Guangquan |publisher=Confuciusinstitutehawaii.org |date= |accessdate=2013-03-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130423053126/http://confuciusinstitutehawaii.org/upcoming-events/past-events/xiangsheng-comic-dialogue-festival-with-master-ding-guangquan/ |archivedate=2013-04-23 |df= }}</ref> Today ''[[xiangsheng]]'' is still a large part of Bates' work, and he performs regularly on [[China Central Television]].
==Other work==
Bates became known publicly through [[Chinese Bridge]] and his travel shows, but he gradually expanded into other activities, including hosting live events and leading outdoors/survival courses. His popularity as a performer and foreign personality on Chinese television has grown steadily: his Chinese micro-blog has grown to tens of thousands of registered followers in just two years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://europe.chinadaily.com.cn/epaper/2011-04/22/content_12376555.htm |title=Information flow draws more people to weibo |publisher=Europe.chinadaily.com.cn |date= |accessdate=2013-03-02}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=October 2018}} '''Mahan Coal Limited''' is a disputed coal mine project in [[Singrauli district]], [[Madhya Pradesh]], India. The project has been opposed by environmentalists since it seeks to pull down 1200 acres of old sal forests<ref name=fp/> for a coal mine.<ref>http://www.downtoearth.org.in/news/mahan-at-all-costs-34230</ref> At least 500,000 prime [[sal tree]]s would be chopped, and 54 villages<ref>http://www.livemint.com/Leisure/fAB8jZp3H6OUkFxdAUVbXK/A-war-to-save-our-forests.html</ref> with a considerable tribal population would be displaced.<ref name=bbc>{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-32443739 | title=How tribal Indians beat big coal firms | date=11 May 2015 | publisher=BBC | accessdate=8 October 2018 }}</ref> However, a group of villagers have also been supporting the mine since it would boost the local economy.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/india/madhya-pradesh-battle-for-coal-divides-mahan-villages/story-yyKkfeKOULc869B9wUVe3I.html | title=Madhya Pradesh: Battle for coal divides Mahan villages | date=4 February 2015 | newspaper=Hindustan Times | first=Neeraj | last=Santoshi | accessdate=8 October 2018 }}</ref>
==Business== Mahan Coal Ltd is a Rs 5,000-crore joint venture between [[Essar Energy]] and the [[Aditya Birla Group]] (Hindalco).<ref>http://www.financialexpress.com/article/industry/companies/essar-hindalcos-mahan-coal-block-lobbying-for-3-yrs-greenpeace-claims-clearance-given-under-pressure/29279/</ref>
Part of the controversy is based on claims by [[Greenpeace India]] that the sanction for the coal mine was given based on a Gram Sabha (village board) resolution that had been forged.<ref> {{cite news | title = Essar, Hindalco’s Mahan coal block: Lobbying for 3 yrs, Greenpeace claims clearance given under pressure | author = Milind Ghatwai | publisher = Financial Express | url = http://www.financialexpress.com/article/industry/companies/essar-hindalcos-mahan-coal-block-lobbying-for-3-yrs-greenpeace-claims-clearance-given-under-pressure/29279/ | date = 13 January 2015 }}Quote: Greenpeace alleged that signatures of most of the villagers had been forged and that the resolution also included signatures of at least six villagers who were not alive. </ref> The land was allocated to the company based on this document. However, in 2014, the coal block land was deallocated by the [[Supreme court|Supreme Court]]<ref>http://www.dnaindia.com/money/report-supreme-court-cancels-214-of-218-coal-block-allocations-gives-operational-mines-6-months-to-wrap-up-2021185</ref> resulting in sharp drops in the company's stocks.<ref>http://www.business-standard.com/article/markets/jspl-hindalco-drop-on-concerns-over-de-allocation-of-coal-mines-114090400273_1.html</ref>
Its original allocation in 2006 is part of the [[Indian coal allocation scam]]. During investigations, the Ministry of Power stated that it had opposed a role for Hindalco in the mine,<ref name=fp> {{cite news | title = The curious case of Moily, Essar, Hindalco and Mahan coal block | author = Jay Mazoomdaar | publisher = Firstpost India | url = http://www.firstpost.com/blogs/the-curious-case-of-moily-essar-hindalco-and-mahan-coal-block-1404631.html | date = 23 Feb 2014 }} quote: Ministry of Power [told the CBI] that it did not recommend the 2006 allocation of Mahan coal block to Hindalco. Instead, it claimed to have asked the Ministry of Coal to allocate Mahan to Essar Power. </ref> but the coal ministry under [[Manmohan Singh]] allocated the mine to the joint company.
===Opposition by Greenpeace India=== Since the BJP government came to power, the project has seen considerable support, and has been linked in the media for the Government actions against Greenpeace India.<ref>http://www.business-standard.com/article/economy-policy/nda-govt-s-grouse-with-greenpeace-mahan-coal-block-protests-115022000023_1.html</ref>
In January 2015, Priya Pillai, a Greenpeace campaigner very active in Mahan, was [[Priya Pillai Offloading|offloaded from a flight]] while she was to meet some British MPs inquiring into the matter.<ref>http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-greenpeace-campaigner-priya-pillai-speaks-to-british-mp-s-via-skype-2052620</ref> The issue is relevant to Britain since Essar Power is listed in the London Stock Exchange.
This incident was seen
In March 2015, the Ministry of Environment did not give a clearance for the project,<ref>http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/mahan-coal-block-mp-greenpeace-union-government/1/429588.html</ref> and subsequently Ministry of Coal announced that the Mahan coal block would not be auctioned for mining, which was viewed as a victory by the tribespeople living in the villages.<ref name=bbc/>

[[File:MANUEL AYAU CORDON.JPG|thumb|right|Manuel Ayau]] '''Manuel Francisco Ayau Cordón''' (December 27, 1925 – August 4, 2010) was the Founder of the [[Universidad Francisco Marroquín]] in Guatemala, a [http://www.newmedia.ufm.edu/gsm/index.php?title=Interview_with_Rose_and_Milton_Friedman leading] private University in Latin America. He was born in [[Guatemala City]], on December 27, 1925. After diverse studies, he obtained a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering from [[Louisiana State University]] in 1950, an L.H.D. from [[Hillsdale College]] in 1973, and an honorary degree in law ([[Legum Doctor]]) from [[Northwood University]] in 1994.
==Scholarly and Laboral Contributions== His many entrepreneurial activities include that of CEO of "Samboro, S.A.", a company dedicated to the production of ceramic tiles; and of directing a group of [[Guatemala]]n industrialists for over forty years in the production of industrial gases and hydro-electric energy. Dr. Ayau has also served on the board of directors of several different companies, including [[IBM]] in Latin America and the Guatemalan local stock and debt exchange, of which he was founding President.
In 1959 he also founded the [http://www.cees.org.gt Center for Economic and Social Studies] (CEES) in Guatemala, to analyze the fundaments and philosophy of free society. In 1972 he was instrumental in founding the [[Universidad Francisco Marroquín|Francisco Marroquín University]], of which he was the first President until 1988.
A member of the [[Mont Pelerin Society]] since 1964, he was its President from 1978 to 1980. He was on the board of directors of the [[Liberty Fund]] in [[Indianapolis]]<ref>http://www.libertyfund.org</ref> and he was also a trustee of the [[Foundation for Economic Education]] in New York. He was also a member of the [[Philadelphia Society]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://phillysoc.org/DistinguishedMembers.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-05-05 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120118151439/http://phillysoc.org/DistinguishedMembers.pdf |archivedate=2012-01-18 |df= }}</ref>
In Guatemala, Dr. Ayau entered politics as a member of congress from 1970 to 1974, and as presidential candidate in the 1990 elections.
Twice he has formed part of the Central Bank council and has been president of two different commercial banks, Vice-President of the National Electrification Institute (INDE), trustee of the Philadelphia Society, and Honorary Member of the engineering society "[[Tau Beta Pi]]".
His last contribution to Guatemala was as President of Asociacion Civil proReforma <ref>"[http://www.newmedia.ufm.edu/presentacionproreforma Conference by Manuel F. Ayau]" at Francisco Marroquin University. Guatemala, January 2008</ref> del Estado de Guatemala.
In 2004 he was [http://noticias.ufm.edu/index.php/Homenaje_a_Manuel_F._Ayau_en_la_Mont_Pelerin_Society awarded] by the Mont Pelerin Society for his contributions to freedom. Manuel Ayau obtained the [http://www.apee.org/award-adam-smith.html Adam Smith Award], from the [[Association of Private Enterprise Education]] in 2005. He obtained the [https://web.archive.org/web/20090221072420/http://juandemariana.org/video/2256/discurso/agradecimiento/manuel/ayau/ Juan de Mariana Award], from the Instituto Juan de Mariana, in Spain, in 2008. That year, at the Universidad Peruana de Ciencias Applicadas, he was appointed Honorary Professor.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.upc.edu.pe/0/modulos/NOT/NOT_DetallarNoticia.aspx?PFL=0&NOT=509 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-03-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110526201109/http://www.upc.edu.pe/0/modulos/NOT/NOT_DetallarNoticia.aspx?PFL=0&NOT=509 |archivedate=2011-05-26 |df= }}</ref>
==Works== Among his most important works are "Como Mejorar el Nivel de Vida", "De Robinson a Viernes", "El Comercio", "La Década Perdida", "El Proceso Económico",<ref>"[http://www.newmedia.ufm.edu/presentacionlibro Conference by Manuel F. Ayau]" at Francisco Marroquin University. Guatemala, October 1994</ref> "No Tenemos que Seguir Siendo Pobres para Siempre" and "Un Juego que no suma cero". He has been published widely in Guatemala and Latin America, as well as in the US, including in "Vision", "The Wall Street Journal", and "The Freeman".
Liberty Fund podcast from 2001, [A Conversation with Manuel Ayau] https://web.archive.org/web/20090404041107/http://65.203.85.21/Home3/Audio.php?recordID=0517.06

footnotes = }} '''Mohamed M. Abou El Enein''' (born September 5, 1951) is an Egyptian businessman, investor, public figure and politician. He is the chairman and founder of Cleopatra Group<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.cleopatraceramics.com/Content/AboutUS?lang=en|title=Abou El Enein's statement on the Company website|website=cleopatraceramics.com|access-date=2016-08-22|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160909142545/http://cleopatraceramics.com/Content/AboutUS?lang=en|archivedate=2016-09-09|df=}}</ref> and the founder of many major projects spread all over [[Egypt]]. He has been a [[Member of parliament|Member of Parliament]] for over 15 years, from 1995 to 2011, being chosen as the Chairman of many Committees and as a representative in many international assemblies. He won several international awards and certificates of honor for his contribution to the various fields of business.
Abou El Enein founded Cleopatra Group in 1983. At the time, he started with the ceramics industry, with one factory. Within a very short period of time, this business expanded to encompass 60% of the local market share, in addition to opening up business in new international markets. Based on this leap forward, Abou El Enein’s business ventures were diversified to include the areas of agriculture, mining, real estate, tourism, media, high-tech projects and aviation (Abou El Enein is also a certified pilot<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://aviationweek.com/paris-air-show-2015/egypt-s-cleopatra-group-signs-g600|title=Egypt’s Cleopatra Group Signs for G600|website=aviationweek.com|access-date=2016-08-22}}</ref>).
== Cleopatra branding and licensing == Beyond his traditional ventures in the ceramics industry, and having carved out a niche for the Cleopatra brand within his industries, Abou El Enein has since then moved on to establish the Cleopatra name and brand in a multitude of other industries and products. Abou El Enein has succeeded in marketing the Cleopatra brand in the hospitality business with Cleo Travel (a travel agency), Cleopatra Silicon Valley (smart card manufacturing), Cleopatra Luxury Hotels & Resorts<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.cleopatraluxury.com|title=Cleopatra Luxury Hotels and Resorts Website|last=|first=|date=|website=www.cleopatraluxury.com|publisher=|access-date=2016-08-23}}</ref> (a number of luxury resorts in [[Sharm el-Sheikh]],<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.cleopatraluxurysharm.com|title=Cleopatra Luxury Resort Sharm el-Sheikh website|last=|first=|date=|website=www.cleopatraluxurysharm.com|publisher=|access-date=2016-08-23}}</ref> [[Hurghada|Hurgada]], Taba, [[Mersa Matruh]]), Cleopatra Media for TV Channels (encompassing 3 TV channels and a news website), among other projects and brands.
== Business Profile == === Business Ventures and Investments === Mohamed Abou El Enein began his entrepreneurial career in international trade between Europe and Egypt back in 1973. In 1983, he established his first factory in the [[10th of Ramadan City]], which was the first of its kind in Egypt to manufacture quality ceramics. Currently the brand name Ceramica Cleopatra has become one of the world's largest producers of ceramics, porcelain and sanitary ware, with 17 factories, under the umbrella of Cleopatra Group.
=== Other Business Ventures === ==== Agricultural development ==== Mohamed Abou El Enein is a pioneer in desert reclamation. His projects in East al-Owinat area, Al Nobaria, 10th of Ramadan, [[East of Suez]], Sahl Al Tina and Wadi Al Mullak, helped to transform the deserted and remote regions into a habitat where farms were established and entire communities thrived, over a total of 13,750 acres.
==== Tourism ==== He founded a number of luxury resorts and hotels in [[Sharm el-Sheikh]], [[Makadi Bay]],<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.cleopatraluxurymakadi.com|title=Cleopatra Luxury Resort Makadi Bay Website|last=|first=|date=|website=www.cleopatraluxurymakadi.com|publisher=|access-date=2016-08-23}}</ref> [[Marsa Alam]], and Taba; employing hundreds of Egyptians, in addition to new projects under construction in [[Mersa Matruh]], with a modern vision for integrated tourism development. Recently, Cleopatra acquired the second largest German tourism company, Aldiana, with ten Club Hotels spread in 6 different countries ([[Tunisia]], [[Spain]], [[Austria]], [[Turkey]], [[Cyprus]] and [[Greece]]).
==== Real estate development ==== Real Estate development<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.cleopatra-realestate.co/|title=Cleopatra Real Estate Website|last=|first=|date=|website=www.cleopatra-realestate.co|publisher=|access-date=2016-08-23}}</ref> also had its share in Abou El Enein’s investments with 5 different projects: * Cleopatra Square in [[6th of October City]] (consisting of 117 plots allocated for high class residential villas ) * Cleopatra Palace in [[Al Shorouk City, Cairo|Shorouk City]] (a first-class compound located over 200 000 m2 and including tow-story villas & 16 residential buildings) * Cleopatra Plaza in [[Nasr City]] (a residential and commercial Complex) * Azarita Plaza in [[Alexandria]] (a residential and commercial complex stretching over 5000 m2 ) * Cleopatra Shopping Mall (due to be inaugurated in the first quarter of 2017)
==== Media ==== Cleopatra Media for TV Channels is a leading Egyptian media network that consists not only of three TV channels ranked among the most-viewed in Egypt and in the Arab World (among the top 10), but also an online website that is among the top five in the country, covering a wide array of public interests, from politics to economics, from entertainment to sports.
==== Aviation ==== Cleopatra Aviation has three main operations. The first part is the Flight Department and Charter Operation. The second branch is the Aircraft Maintenance Facility. And the final branch centers on providing transit Business jets with handling, servicing and passengers’ services in Cairo. Cleopatra Aviation is currently in the final phase of obtaining their Egyptian Air Operating Charter in the very near future.
==== Cleopatra Silicon Valley ==== CSV is a high-tech industrial complex. Abou El Enein established the [[Smart card|Smart Card]] factory, the first and largest factory of its kind in Egypt. It produces all kinds of smart cards, starting from scratch cards, memory cards, SIM cards to credit cards.
== Political Activity == * Abou El Enein was a member of the People's Assembly since 1995. In 2005, he was elected “Chairman of the Committee on Housing, Public Utilities and Construction” (2000 - 2005), then the “Chairman of the Committee on Industry and Energy” (2005-2011). * On the international level, Abou El Enein was elected in 2010<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.pam.int/?m=news&id=109|title=1st Operational meeting of the PAM panel on external trade and investments in the Mediterranean. 12-13 November 2010, Naples, Italy|website=www.pam.int|access-date=2016-08-22}}</ref> as the Chairman of the [[Parliamentary Assembly of the Mediterranean]] (PAM), based in [[Malta]], which encompasses 37 member countries north and south of the Mediterranean. * He was also elected as the Chairman of the Committee on Economic and Financial Affairs, Social Affairs and Education of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Union for the Mediterranean (PA-UfM) for two consecutive terms. * The Euro-Med Parliament honored him and awarded him, as the representative of all Parliamentary Members of the southern Mediterranean countries, the “Parliamentary Excellence Award” in recognition for his support of the international and regional parliamentary effort. * The Parliamentary Assembly of the Mediterranean (PAM) selected him to be its “Roving Ambassador”,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://unispal.un.org/databases/dprtest/ngoweb.nsf/f12fded4d0597000852573fc005b9471/28aa0a5012afff39852577ab0053cdf9?OpenDocument|title="The urgency of addressing the permanent status issues – Borders, Jerusalem, settlements, refugees, water" Qawra, Malta, 12 and 13 February|last=|first=|date=|website=unispal.un.org|publisher=|access-date=2016-08-22}}</ref> as well as its “Permanent Representative to the [[Arab League|League of Arab States]]”
== Honorary Positions == * July 2012: International Business and Economic Consultant by the [[United Nations|UN]] World Organization for Trade in Services for his industrial, commercial, agricultural and tourism experience and contributions for over 40 years. * January & February 2012: Accredited International and Industrial Arbitrator by the International Council of Arbitration, making him eligible to settle industrial disputes and solving commercial and industrial problems and obstacles among bodies, companies and factories. * Advisor to International Arbitration for the Industrial and Commercial Sector by Natural and Human Resources Development Center - Institute of African Studies - Cairo University.
== Civic Society Activities == Abou El Enein has a distinct and widely recognized contribution to social work. * He was elected President of the Egyptian-European Council since 2007. The Council is one of civil society institutions, which plays an important role in strengthening economic cooperation and mutual cultural and political relations between Egypt and Europe. * Corporate social responsibility features high on the agenda of Abou El Enein. In 2001, he established the “Abou El Enein Organization for Social Activities & Charity”. This Organization offers literacy classes, undertakes schools development, and aims at contributing to human development.
== Personal == Mohamed M. Abou El Enein is married and has three sons and a daughter. He is a sports fan who has been playing [[tennis]] for years. His preferred family vacation is spent in skiing resorts, which is yet another favored sport.

A '''multilateral exchange''' is a transaction, or forum for transactions, which involve more than two parties.
For example, Alice gives Bob an apple in exchange for an orange, that is a bilateral exchange. A multilateral exchange would involve a third party, for example: Alice gives an apple to Bob who gives an orange to Charles, who gives a pear to Alice.
In the real world, such transactions are spread over time, and involved items of different values, and involve many more parties. A special type of accounting is used for this, called [[mutual credit]], or [[credit clearing]].
==Accounting== Although any accounting framework can be used, there is one approach that fits naturally for multilateral exchange. It is the simplest possible database/spreadsheet design, [[single-entry bookkeeping system|single-entry bookkeeping]] rather than [[Double-entry bookkeeping system|double-entry bookkeeping]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2017}}
All accounts begin with a balance of zero, meaning they owe nothing and are owed nothing. An account may only close at zero, meaning it has given as much as it has received, i.e. that the exchange is complete with respect to all the other accounts. When a transaction happens, an entry is made in an accounting journal of a payment, or credit flowing in the opposite direction.
{| class="wikitable" |- ! #id !! Payee !! Payer !! Amount !! Description |- | 1 || Ann || Bob || 10 || Bob gave Ann an Apple |- | 2 || Bob || Charlie || 5 || Charlie gave Bob an Apricot |- | 3 || Charlie || Ann || 10 || Ann gave Charlie an Orange |- | Volume || || || 15 || |} Account balances are derived by 'adding up' the journal. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Name !! Balance !! Meaning |- | Ann || 0 || Balanced - Ann may close her account |- | Bob || +10-5=5 || Bob is owed (and obliged to take) goods and services to the value of 5 units |- | Charlie || +5-10=-5 || Charlie owes (and is obliged to give) goods and services to the value of 5 units |- | Total || 0 || nothing entered or left this closed system of accounts. |} The sum of all account balances is ''a priori'' [[zero]]. Accounts which close (or are retired) above zero have given more value to the other accounts than they have received and vice versa. Thus a positive balance represents not value *in* the account, but value *owed* to that account by (the aggregate of) all other accounts.
An account's balance in such a system, indicates not the position of the account with respect to past activities with other accounts, but also the activity needed to complete the exchange. thus a balance of +10 means that not only has the account delivered +10 more value to the other members than it has received, but that in order to complete the exchange it intends to receive +10 more in the future than it delivers.
Bob's obligation to spend 5, exactly matches Charlie's obligation to earn 5.
==See also== * [[Mutual credit]] * [[Mutualism (economic theory)]]
==Further reading== * Nikaido, Hukukane, [http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.1467-999X.1956.tb00099.x/full "On the classical multilateral exchange problem"], ''Metroeconomica'', vol. 8, iss. 2, pp. 135-145, June 1956. * Ikeo, Aiko, ''A History of Economic Science in Japan'', Routledge, 2014 {{ISBN|1317747534}}. Has extensive discussion of Nikaido's work. * Wood, John Cunningham, ''Karl Marx's Economics: Critical Assessments'', Taylor & Francis, 2004 {{ISBN|0415065100}} (reprint: first published 1988). Discusses multilateral exchange in the context of [[Marxian economics]], pp. 290-293. * Raymond, Ruth; Fowler, Cary, [https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=0VwSLmf5YFkC "Sharing the non-monetary benefits of agricultural biodiversity"], ''[[Issues in Genetic Resources]]'', no. 5, September 2001. Discusses multilateral exchange in the context of agricultural biodiversity.

'''Nasser Ibrahim Al-Rashid''' (born 1939) ({{lang-ar|ناصر إبراهيم الرشيد الليلا}}) is a [[Saudi]] businessman. He is reputedly an influential advisor to the [[Saudi royal family]] and a US dollar billionaire. However he is not included in the ''[[Forbes]]'' list of the world's richest people as his personal wealth, like that of many Saudi insiders, cannot be assessed with much accuracy from publicly available information.
Al-Rashid completed his B.S. at the [[University of Texas at Austin|University of Texas]] in 1965, and his PhD at the university in 1970. He has since remained a prominent donor to the University of Texas, and has been honoured by the university at its Distinguished Alumnus Awards ceremony.<ref name="Communications1992">{{cite book|author=Emmis Communications|title=The Alcalde|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=yNYDAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA19|date=March 1992|publisher=Emmis Communications|pages=19–|issn=1535-993X}}</ref> The Dr Nasser Ibrahim Al-Rashid Strength and Training Center at the university is named in his honour. He is also a large donor to the [[University of Miami]] (FL) and its medical school. He owns one of the largest yachts in the world, the ''[[Lady Moura]]'', which reportedly cost over [[US$]]200 mm to build in the late 1980s. In March 1987 Al-Rashid was one of the guests at a state banquet hosted by [[Elizabeth II|Queen Elizabeth II]] for [[Fahd of Saudi Arabia|King Fahd]] at Buckingham Palace.<ref name=TimesMar87>{{cite news|last1=|first1=|title=Court Circular|url=http://find.galegroup.com/ttda/infomark.do?&source=gale&prodId=TTDA&userGroupName=wes_ttda&tabID=T003&docPage=article&searchType=BasicSearchForm&docId=IF500264869&type=multipage&contentSet=LTO&version=1.0|accessdate=13 November 2015|work=The Times|issue=62725|date=25 March 1987|page=16|subscription=yes|via=The Times Digital Archive}}</ref>
His previous wife, [[Mouna Ayoub]], a [[Lebanon|Lebanese]] woman, is considered to be a French socialite. Ayoub subsequently wrote a memoir of their marriage, ''La vérité (The Truth)'', in which Nasser Ibrahim Al-Rashid is referred to as "Amir al-Tharik".<ref name=TelegOct15>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/08/27/style/tmagazine/t_w_1505_remix_eastern_.html|title=Petro Dollies|author=Sameer Reddy|date=24 October 2015|work=The New York Times|accessdate=13 November 2015}}</ref> In the memoir Ayoub likened her marriage to a "...a gilded cage where I felt myself to be unjustly treated and powerless...I was given the most sumptuous dresses and amassed a huge collection of jewels, yet I could only wear my black Arab robe and a veil. I was forbidden to speak to men, forbidden to see female friends not approved by my husband, forbidden to play sport, forbidden to laugh, or speak loudly in public." Al-Rashid and his eldest son with Ayoub subsequently sued the publishers of the memoir in the French courts to try and stop publication of the memoir, alleging a breach of their privacy.<ref name=GuardJun00>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2000/jun/20/jonhenley|title=Style victim blames it all on Saudis|author=Jon Henley|date=20 June 2000|work=The Guardian|accessdate=13 November 2015}}</ref>
He is currently married to Safia El Malqui, they have been together since early 1998. Not much is known publicly of al-Rashid, who prior to taking delivery of his yacht, maintained a relatively low profile among the wealthy Saudi elite.
Nasser Ibrahim Al-Rashid was one of three Saudi Arabian businessmen to donate over $US1 million to the [[Clinton Presidential Center]].<ref name=TimesNov98>{{cite news|last1=|first1=|title=Distant donors|url=http://find.galegroup.com/ttda/infomark.do?&source=gale&prodId=TTDA&userGroupName=wes_ttda&tabID=T003&docPage=article&searchType=BasicSearchForm&docId=IF503798530&type=multipage&contentSet=LTO&version=1.0|accessdate=13 November 2015|work=The Times|issue=69486|date=20 November 2008|page=48|subscription=yes|via=The Times Digital Archive}}</ref>
==Trivia== *On Saturday 19 May 2007, one of his yachts, ''[[Lady Moura]]'', nearly ran aground by the [[Cannes]] coastline during the film festival, where it suffered hull damage and took on water. It was moored in Monaco. On 2 February 2010 ''Lady Moura'' was moored in [[Palma, Majorca]], however it has since returned to Monaco.<ref>[http://tf1.lci.fr/infos/france/faits-divers/0,,3450496,00-enorme-yacht-echoue-baie-cannes-.html Mer : Un énorme yacht s'échoue en baie de Cannes - France<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
